intro: Erycibe sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Sumatra and Borneo. It is a climbing vine that belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
